chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
items.plainText: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

items.text: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;
items.plainText: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;

items.text: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
items.plainText: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;

items.text: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
items.plainText: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

items.text: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
items.plainText: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

items.text: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
items.plainText: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

items.text: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
items.plainText: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

items.text: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
items.plainText: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

items.text: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
items.plainText: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

items.text: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
items.plainText: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

items.text: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
items.plainText: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

items.text: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
items.plainText: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

items.text: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
items.plainText: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

items.text: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
items.plainText: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

items.text: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
items.plainText: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

items.text: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
items.plainText: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

items.text: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
items.plainText: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

items.text: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
items.plainText: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

items.text: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
items.plainText: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

items.text: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
items.plainText: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

items.text: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
items.plainText: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

items.text: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
items.plainText: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

items.text: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
items.plainText: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
